data.title: Douglas Booth and Bel Powley engaged and 'happy' after gorgeous picnic proposal
data.meta_description: The Riot Club star Douglas Booth and The Morning Show actress Bel Powley have revealed their engagement after he proposed to her during a picnic on Primrose Hil, London
data.text:
Actors Douglas Booth and Bel Powley have announced their engagement.

The Riot Club star Douglas, 28, took to social media on Saturday to reveal his engagement to his Mary Shelley co-star Bel.

The actor shared three images on Instagram, beginning with a selfie of him laughing beside a jubilant Bel holding her hand up with a shining jewelled band on her ring finger.

The second showed a touchingly prepared picnic on Primrose Hill in London and a third showed Bel sat in the sunshine beside the picnic.

Douglas captioned the snaps: "Very, VERY happy! [laughing emoji] @belpowley [champagne glasses emoji, red heart emoji]".

Bel also shared some snaps, including one of the pair sat at home with Douglas wearing a hat, jacket and white t-shirt and herself in a red floral mini-dress with a large white collar.

The actress wrote a message acknowledging England's current success in UEFA Euros 2020, penning: "Football’s coming home…and so is my husband [football emojis, black flag emojis, ring emojis, football emojis, black flag emojis]".

A plethora of famous faces took to the comments sections on both posts to share their happiness at the pair's wonderful news.

Black Widow star Florence Pugh penned on Bel's post: "Ahhhhh!!!! Congratulations chicken!! Amazing news. X".

Oscar-winning actress Reese Witherspoo n wrote on Bel's post: "WOOOOOHOOOOOO!!!"

She also wrote on Douglas': "Well this is happy news. Congrats [red-heart emojis]".

Elsewhere, Glee alum Dianna Agron commented: "Love love love [red heart emoji]".

The Crown actor Josh O'Connor posted red-heart emojis on both of their posts.

Meanwhile, Peaky Blinder actor Sam Claflin wrote on Douglas' post: "YOU GUYS [heart-eyes emoji, red heart emoji] No freakin’ way."

Sexy Beast star Ray Winstone penned: "Congratulations to you both. Much love. The Winnies [heart-eyes emoji]".

Finally, Skins alum Kaya Scodelario commented: "Awwww congratulations! [raised hands emoji, red heart emojis]".

Douglas and Bel have been romantically linked since working together on the set of the 2017 film Mary Shelley, which was filmed in 2016.

Booth rose to fame after starring as Boy George in the film Worried About the Boy and went on to appear in films such The Dirt, Romeo & Juliet, Noah, and Jupiter Ascending.

Meanwhile, Bel Powley rose to prominence with the film The Diary of a Teenage Girl and later appeared in A Royal Night Out, Wilding, Ashes in the Snow, and The King of Staten Island.

She currently stars opposite Reese Witherspoon in the Apple TV drama series The Morning Show.

Congratulations to Douglas and Bel!
